properties.Name: CustomsValuationMethod
properties.Description:
The method for determining by Customs the dutiable value of imported goods.

Ex:
AD VALOREM
DEDUCTIVE VALUE
TRANSACTION VALUE OF IDENTICAL ITEMS
TRANSACTION VALUE OF ITEMS
TRANSACTION VALUE OF SIMILAR ITEMS

where:

AD VALOREM
A duty assesses as a percentage rate or value of the imported merchandise.

DEDUCTIVE VALUE
A valuation method used to determine the value of imported merchandise if the transaction value of identical merchandise or similar merchandise cannot be determined.

The deductive value method is used by Customs unless the Importer has designated the Computed Value as the designated method of appraising the value of the merchandise.

The Deductive Value is the resale price in the US after importation of the goods with deductions for commissions, general expenses, transportation costs, insurance costs and customs duties.

TRANSACTION VALUE OF IDENTICAL ITEMS
The method for determining by Customs the dutiable value of imported goods.

Possible methods are:

(1) Transaction value of goods
(2) Transaction value of identical merchandise
(3) Transaction value of similar merchandise

TRANSACTION VALUE OF ITEMS
The method for determining by Customs the dutiable value of imported goods.

Possible methods are:

(1) Transaction value of goods
(2) Transaction value of identical merchandise
(3) Transaction value of similar merchandise

TRANSACTION VALUE OF SIMILAR ITEMS
The method for determining by Customs the dutiable value of imported goods.

Possible methods are:

(1) Transaction value of goods
(2) Transaction value of identical merchandise
(3) Transaction value of similar merchandise

Columns.Name: CustomsValuationMethodId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the Customs Valuation Method.

Columns.Name: CustomsValuationMethodName
Columns.Description: The name of the Customs Valuation Method.

Columns.Name: CustomsValuationMethodDescription
Columns.Description: The description of the Customs Valuation Method.
